clean_content:
Definition / general

* Midline in floor of mouth* Present at birth but asymptomatic until inflamed

Case reports

* 11 year old boy with sublingual epidermoid cyst ([J Med Case Rep 2007;1:87](17875211))* 21 year old woman with sublingual dermoid cyst and difficulty in swallowing food ([Case Rep Otolaryngol 2012;2012:634949](23056976))* 25 year old man with epidermoid cyst presenting as large sublingual swelling ([J Can Dent Assoc 2007;73:525](17672959))

Clinical images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavitydermoidcystclinical1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3465894/figure/fig1/)

Submental swelling

Gross images

Contributed by Dhiraj B. Nikumbh, M.D.  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityIntratonsillarmultepidinclusioncystNikumbh01new.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityIntratonsillarmultepidinclusioncystNikumbh01new.jpg)

Multiple tonsillar epidermoid cyst

  
  
Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavitydermoidcystgross1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3465894/figure/fig3/)

Sublingual dermoid cyst

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavitydermoidcystgross2.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2020471/figure/F2/)

Sublingual epidermoid cyst

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Lined by squamous epithelium, contains skin adnexae if dermoid cyst

Microscopic (histologic) images

Contributed by Dhiraj B. Nikumbh, M.D.
